page.title: 06Eric Burton - Farmer.
page.content: Eight am and everyone arrives at work for the start of another day. I spend the first few minutes telling the two men who work under me what I would like them to do. At this time of the year we have a very important operation to carry out. It is now that we are preparing the ground to put in the seed for the next year's harvest. This starts off with ploughing (inverting the topsoil), then breaking it down into a friable seedbed before drilling the seed. In our case this is wheat for grinding into flour and barley for feeding to animals. Having set one or other of these tasks into operation, I now turn to my own routine morning work.
